body_html:
Thanks for filing the issue @johngrabner

I suspect the cuDNN v6.1 in the TensorFlow Windows installation instructions is a typo, and the correct version should be cuDNN v6.0. Notice that the linux instructions mention v6.0.
https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_linux

@mrry can you confirm that this is a typo? If so I'll fix up the instructions; if not we'll need to find cuDNN v6.1 :)
body_text:

I suspect the cuDNN v6.1 in the TensorFlow Windows installation instructions is a typo, and the correct version should be cuDNN v6.0.  Notice that the linux instructions mention v6.0.
https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_linux
@mrry can you confirm that this is a typo?  If so I'll fix up the instructions; if not we'll need to find cuDNN v6.1  :)
body:
Thanks for filing the issue @johngrabner 

I suspect the `cuDNN v6.1` in the TensorFlow Windows installation instructions is a typo, and the correct version should be `cuDNN v6.0`.  Notice that the linux instructions mention `v6.0`.
https://www.tensorflow.org/install/install_linux

@mrry can you confirm that this is a typo?  If so I'll fix up the instructions; if not we'll need to find `cuDNN v6.1`  :)
